text: I think that Go's great cryptography uh
libraries are uh a significant reason
for Go's success a lot of people
reference um you know the uh uh
parallelism uh channels um you know uh
static builds um a whole bunch of other
stuff but uh for me um what kind of
first got me really using go on a daily
basis was uh the awesome cryptography um
packages um and when you think about it
like um static builds um they're amazing
it's like one of the best features of go
but those wouldn't static builds
wouldn't really work if go didn't have
great cryptographic libraries if go had
to link to op SSL uh in order to do a
htps request if every time you wanted to
use the network uh with a go Application
you had to be running inside of a
container with OP SSL properly installed
and um you know that would that that
kind of um shoots the whole static
builds right in the foot so I think um
you know personally I I got into go
because I wanted to do things like um
build little uh reverse proxies that
could um serve TLS traffic with
certificates that you know came off from
a database if you've ever tried to use
op ssl's uh libraries like besides being
a um a c project with um years of crof
and um problems um the interfaces are
just really hard to to use properly part
of it's because it's got both like a
evented and synchronous mode and then um
as they've added um new apis they
haven't really cleaned up the old ones
so doing just something simple maybe not
simple but something like I want to be
able to terminate a TLS connection and I
want to look up the certificate and key
from a database that's actually kind of
hard to do with just open us cell and
and go was like the first language um
that I saw that was reallying willing to
say like we're going to we're going to
like Implement our own TS stack and
we're not gonna like pick up this thing
over here that has all these problems um
so yeah I think like goes security team
is amazing uh agl's work um everyone's
work on the team is is awesome and I
think it's kind of like the unsung hero
of go success so Ben saying don't use
